m_DescList: Adding <color=#FF68DD>?</color> after a regular expression indicates that the preceding expression may appear 0 or 1 time.
For instance, <color=#3173FF>\d</color><color=#FF68DD>+</color><color=#AB2800>%</color><color=#FF68DD>?</color> means: One or more digits, optionally followed by a single "%" character.
You have now obtained an "ASCII" character art piece. Count all the digit '8's. If an '8' is preceded by a '.', include the '.' as well.
For example, the expected matching result for <color=#3c3cff>11.88</color> is <color=#666666>11</color><color=#3c3cff>.88</color>
Construct a regular expression to pass all tests on the right.
